channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Billionaire YouTuber MrBeast says he actually has ‘very little money’ and is borrowing cash from his mom to pay for his wedding
item.description: "A decade ago before I blew up everyone in my life told me I was to obsessed and constantly told I’d never make it," Jimmy Donaldson wrote on X.

item.title: Diamondback’s Viper Energy buys Sitio Royalties for $4.1 billion in merger of the top two minerals players
item.description: The minerals and royalties deal continues Diamondback's ascent as the top producer focused on the still-booming Permian Basin.

item.title: Black Families Are Leaving New York. Can a Pastor’s Plan End the Exodus?
item.description: In the East New York neighborhood of Brooklyn, a pastor is devoting his time to building affordable housing for his congregation.

item.title: Dutch Government Collapses After Geert Wilders Withdraws Right-Wing Party
item.description: The populist Geert Wilders withdrew his right-wing party from the ruling coalition, saying partners were stalling plans for the Netherlands’ “strictes...

item.title: Ukraine Says It Struck Crimea Bridge
item.description: It would be the third such attack. The claim comes two days after one of Ukraine’s most ambitious operations of the war, deep inside Russia.

item.title: Fewer people are quitting their jobs right now—but layoffs are on the rise
item.description: Uncertainty in the economy means more people are trying to stay in their jobs, so long as employers choose to keep them around.

item.title: Snowflake CEO says environment for deals is good as VC-backed startups look for exits
item.description: As Snowflake announced the acquisition of Crunchy Data for a reported $250 million, CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy shared his thought on the current environmen...

item.title: At Least 27 Killed After Israeli Soldiers Open Fire Near Gaza Aid Site
item.description: It was the second such shooting by Israeli forces in three days near the same aid site in southern Gaza, which is part of a contentious new Israeli an...

item.title: Ukraine’s Drone Strike on Russia Aims to Change Putin’s Calculus
item.description: Kyiv’s attack on the country’s bomber fleet appeared designed to show Russia’s leader that continuing the war carries big risks for Moscow.

item.title: Chipotle’s new CEO is bringing back a missing ingredient to hit the chain’s next goal—raising annual sales per store to $4 million
item.description: You can now expect a warmer greeting from your Chipotle burrito slinger.

item.title: Jacinda Ardern, New Zealand’s Former Prime Minister, Pushes Kindness in New Book
item.description: The former prime minister, who led New Zealand through the pandemic, has published a memoir arguing for more empathy in politics.

item.title: At Least 27 Killed After Israeli Soldiers Open Fire Near Gaza Aid Site
item.description: It was the second such shooting by Israeli forces in three days near the same aid site in southern Gaza, which is part of a contentious new Israeli an...

item.title: Map: 5.8-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Turkey
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Live Updates: South Korea’s Opposition Leader Likely to Be Next President, Exit Poll Shows
item.description: The campaign of Lee Jae-myung, a center-left candidate, rode a wave of anger against Yoon Suk Yeol, who was ousted for imposing martial law.

item.title: Dutch Government Collapses After Geert Wilders Withdraws Right-Wing Party
